Hi there, so after my recent question I had about programming a motor, the climbing arm on our robot now is using two motors. I am implying that to make that work, I would have to use arrays, but seeing as I am getting more used to GDScript than Java, I have no idea what I am doing, my code is located here: GitHub link

I know the climber subsystem is going to use 2 motors to be able to climb the cage. Both motors are Neos(I tried to find the plural of Neo) controlled by 2 Spark Maxes (Also tried the plural one here). The code is command based

If I understand correctly, your team is using 2 motors to get more power to drive the climb arm.

With that in mind, you just need a second SparkMax object that you configure as a ‚Äúfollower‚Äù of the first one.

github.com

REVrobotics/SPARK-MAX-Examples/blob/master/Java/Motor Follower/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java

package frc.robot;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot;

import com.revrobotics.CANSparkMax;
import com.revrobotics.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType;

/**
 * This sample program shows how to control a motor using a joystick. In the
 * operator control part of the program, the joystick is read and the value is
 * written to the motor.
 *
This file has been truncated. show original

Here is an example from REV on how to set that up.

You‚Äôre right, they changed the API in 2025, now that configuration is in the SparkBaseConfig class

codedocs.revrobotics.com

SparkBaseConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

declaration: package: com.revrobotics.spark.config, class: SparkBaseConfig

This does the same thing.

My mistake!
